intro: Lotononis stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, pale blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats.
